title: Should Talon be nerfed?
body: With assassins like Talon and Zed utilising lethality so well, it'll be soon that either they get nerfed or lethality gets nerfed. So, does Talon need a nerf or is he the most balanced assassin to come out of the assassin rework?

replies.body:
I think Talon needs a good hard look at. His lvl 3-4 power spike is pretty much a guaranteed kill if you're even slightly competent at him.
His wall hop ability needs a longer CD. He is completely uncatchable in the jungle and there is no way to outplay him and escape if he has the upper hand.  As far as talon is concerned the map obsticals don't exist.  Good use of this one ability it makes him a devastating roamer a great assassin and uncatchable. The fact he is an AD champ with AOE harass makes harass/farming overly easy for him he doesn't have to choose one over the other. 
Not to mention Jarvan, Anivia, Azir, Tahlia and Yorik might as well just not play a game against a talon as each or there best area control abilities don't work on him, in fact, they just give him a movement boost as he uses their ability against them.
Reading the developers notes on his rework one of their goals was to make him less of a burst one trick pony. The problem is his burst is now better than ever and uses less mana and cooldowns + he now is more mobile than he was + lethality is broken as fuck and often comes bundled on items that you do not have to sacrifice built utility to purchase.

Basically fuck Talon.

A proper burst combo actually takes a while. Depending on the situations it's a  lot that goes into his full burst potential.

W then Q auto ult auto (passive starts) then hydra auto again. All up its like 2-3sec for his full bust. Not to menion if you wait for dusk blade passive.

I believe that Talon needs more skill in order to utilise his kit well.

For instance, you shouldn't always try to proc your passive as it can cause you to get caught out and die

The use of your Q is also important. You could use it as an engage during your ultimate or you could use the crit to dish out massive damage **OR** use the heal for sustain in lane

Spamming W in lane is a big no-no for Talon mains because running out of mana can prove to be fatal, especially in the laning phase. It's ok to use W to harass but **ONLY** if you know that you'll land both parts of it.

Talon's E requires a lot of predictions. Just spamming it can leave you with no escape at all. That's why most Talons won't use their E unless they are chasing or escaping.

Finally Talon's ultimate needs at least a little skill to utilise it well. Most people assume that Talon's ultimate is used for escapes since it grants invisibility.  Chaining it with Q to open an all in combo that can secure a kill.

What I meant was that the reason lethality was buffed was because Talon and Zed need it to have the power they need. That's why **THEY** utilise it so well.

Lethality is a shit stat, and will always be too strong or too weak by design.

The fact that Assassin's need armor penetration is a fact, but they made lethality too strong to the point where everyone can abuse it.

It's likely no assassin will be touched and lethality gets nerfed if riot has any clue what they are doing with balancing, but they have no clue because a bunch of the balance department are bronze/silver, so who the fuck knows.

Zed was better off than talon, but talon needed it as he was the heaviest assassin flunk, they did say if they didn't end up buffing lethality talon would get a direct buff, atm talon is in a good spot, though the other ad champs are now too strong.
